document_data.caption: A greater shadowrath pictured on the right.
document_data.name: Greater Shadowrath
document_data.mainbody: '''Greater shadowraths''', which were also called '''abysskin''', were a powerful form of [[undead]] that had a connection with the dangerous [[artifact]] known as the ''[[Crown of Horns]]''.
document_data.Description: A greater shadowrath appeared as they did when they were alive with the exception of their lack of eyes, skeleton, and internal organs. These missing parts were replaced with pure [[negative energy]] that was somewhat concealed by the clothing or [[armor]] worn at the time of their death. The crackling black negative energy was visible through the creature's eyes, open mouth, and any wounds.
document_data.Personality: These creatures retained the intelligence they possessed in life.
document_data.Combat: Any magical or [[psionic]] abilities acquired by a lesser shadowrath during their life were lost upon their transformation. The touch of a greater shadowrath caused intense pain in the target as well as draining a portion of their lifeforce. Any victim drained of their entire lifeforce suffered an irreversible death.
document_data.Society: These creatures often acted as bodyguards for whoever wore the ''Crown of Horns''. They followed any commands given by the ''Crown'' bearer, and often led groups of [[lesser shadowrath]]s. If left uncontrolled for some reason, a greater shadowrath sought to destroy spellcasters or followers of [[Mystra]].
document_data.History: Greater shadowraths were created by the "Myrkul's Hand" power of the ''Crown of Horns''.
